issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:

A restart can fill several logs with these errors:

{code}
[root@g-08-11 ~]# ll /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log*
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus  8898385 Aug 25 20:59 /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 10492360 Aug 25 16:59 /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log.1
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 10485904 Aug 25 16:59 /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log.2
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 10490635 Aug 25 16:58 /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log.3
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 10492802 Aug 25 16:48 /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log.4
-rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       10487053 Aug 25 16:47 /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log.5
{code}

We may want to log some errors, but most of these stack traces have no benefit or may be bugs.
fields.summary: CloudFormation excessive errors logged when cloud controller restarted

comments.body: [~ethomas], we should check for specific errors and log an INFO or DEBUG message without stacktrace for expected connection issues, we could also wait a few seconds before continuing to prevent immediate retries when an expected connection error occurs.

git branch dev-ethomas-EUCA-11301
git show a895a503ad7b52ea6509c149f05a0af65ce298d9
git show 62ec1804bbaf409731c1b915a20e6d51f3950f54

Found several errors that can occur mainly when CLC is down and that fill the logs, caused these errors not to do a stack trace in the log, and caused the thread to wait a few seconds.  Prior to this, the logs would be filled as these errors would occur several times a second.  The other commit removed some of this error handling from places in the code which were not the error log culprit and added one more error case there.
[~ethomas], the fix looks good to me.

Fix Verified.

Do not see egregious errors of this nature logged on UFSs when CLC is restarted.Tested on the scale setup.
